children.subject: Is CoE considering an extension as well?
Please read the post thoroughly. This is for students in L&S.
I should’ve phrased my question better. Will CoE students not have the deadline to change the grading option of an H/SS course extended to November 8th?
COE info was just released and is included in this post.
Does this include CoE students who are taking H/SS courses?
Was the olf LNS deadline to PNP today @ exactly 11:59 pm?
Updates on what exactly? This is a college policy update so please refer to your college with any questions. This was posted here as a courtesy.

This email was sent out 5 hours ago:

Dear L&S students,

As you may recall from an email sent Friday afternoon, the College is extending the grading option change deadline to this Friday, November 8.  Our Dean has been successful in having CalCentral reopen L&S student access to make grading option changes through Friday, November 8.  You can make grading option changes now on CalCentral.

Not all UC Berkeley Colleges are extending the deadline, so if you are a simultaneous degree student we recommend that you consult with your other College as well.

Thank you for your patience,

Office of Undergraduate Advising
College of Letters and Science
Are there any updates on this? I would like to change one of my classes.

history.content:
IMPORTANT! The grading option deadline has been extended to NEXT Friday, November 8th. See below for details and contact L&S with questions.

L&S Alert: Grading Option Deadline Extended
Today would normally be the last day for L&S students to change their grading option from letter grade to P/NP or from P/NP to letter grade.  Given the extraordinary nature of this semester, the College is extending that deadline to next Friday, November 8th.

For technical reasons CalCentral will, initially at least, not allow you to change the option after tonight's deadline. Don’t worry about that. We don't quite know yet how we will process your grading options changes during next week, but there will be a way to do it. CalCentral may be reopened or there may be a manual petition process. More news to follow early next week.

Bob Jacobsen
Dean, L&S Undergraduate Division

_______________________

COE Alert: Grading option deadline for non-technical courses extended

Due to the loss of instructional days during the PG&E power outages, the College of Engineering is extending the deadline for COE undergraduates to change their grading options in non-technical courses to Friday, November 8.

Note that the deadline for COE undergraduates to change grading options in technical courses was September 27.

We know that CalCentral, as of now, will not allow you to change your grading options after 11:59 p.m. tonight. We don't know yet how you will submit your grading option changes next week, but there will be a way to do it, either via paper petition submitted to ESS, or via CalCentral. Depending upon the process, the deadline on Friday, 11/8, will be either 4:30 p.m. (if paper petition) or 11:59 p.m. (if CalCentral). For now, please know that you have an additional week to decide upon your grading options for your non-technical courses, and there will be a process in place next week. We'll send more information as soon as we know how to proceed. 

Engineering Student Services

COE students should contact their ESS advisers for questions.
